instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 30 seconds after boot screen scrambles
threads.message: Hi. I have an A1278  that after 30 seconds the screen scrambles. At first, my thought was that it was going to be an LCD/cable replacement. I removed the board to look it it over and found that U2600 and the area around it was liquid damaged. I have already replaced the damaged components and everything is functioning normal. My question is; can you give me a general idea of how this damaged circuit effected the display image? I am currently tracing through the schematic but a hint would definitely be helpful. Thanks in advance.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 30 seconds after boot screen scrambles
threads.message: does it happen when you tap on the ram slot?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 30 seconds after boot screen scrambles
threads.message: No... Tapping on board and RAM slot didn't make a difference. It would boot up, get to OS for like 30 seconds. Then the screen would go white with full spectrum of color static, then go black. After that happened a couple times that computer would just not POST anymore, just turn on with fans at full throttle. Thats when I pulled the board and notice the damage on U2600 and surrounding area. Its no biggie, everything is working now since component replacement. I was just curious to know how problem with u2600 would effect LCD in that way. Thanks.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 30 seconds after boot screen scrambles
threads.message:
Thats the clock. If that goes out, then all signals go out of sync, causing all kinds of anomalies.

Its more odd you had a intermittently working clock.
